180  {
181  //TODO: make this functionality available via an adaptor over generic STL like allocator
182  const size_t nfs_cache_line_size = NFS_LineSize;
183  __TBB_ASSERT( nfs_cache_line_size <= NFS_MaxLineSize, "illegal value for NFS_LineSize" );
184  __TBB_ASSERT( is_power_of_two(nfs_cache_line_size), "must be power of two" );
185  size_t bytes = n*element_size;
186 
187  if (bytes<n || bytes+nfs_cache_line_size<bytes) {
188  // Overflow
189  throw_exception(eid_bad_alloc);
190  }
191  // scalable_aligned_malloc considers zero size request an error, and returns NULL
192  if (bytes==0) bytes = 1;
193 
194  void* result = (*padded_allocate_handler)( bytes, nfs_cache_line_size );
195  if (!result)
196  throw_exception(eid_bad_alloc);
197 
198  __TBB_ASSERT( is_aligned(result, nfs_cache_line_size), "The address returned isn't aligned to cache line size" );
199  return result;
200 }

void tbb::internal::NFS_Free ( void *  p)

Free memory allocated by NFS_Allocate.

Freeing a NULL pointer is allowed, but has no effect.

size_t __TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC scalable_msize ( void *  ptr)

The analogue of msize/malloc_size/malloc_usable_size. Returns the usable size of a memory block previously allocated by scalable*, or 0 (zero) if ptr does not point to such a block.

Variable Documentation

const size_t tbb::internal::NFS_MaxLineSize = 128

Compile-time constant that is upper bound on cache line/sector size.

It should be used only in situations where having a compile-time upper bound is more useful than a run-time exact answer.

Definition at line 220 of file tbb_stddef.h.

Referenced by tbb::internal::arena::allocate_arena(), tbb::internal::arena_slot::allocate_task_pool(), tbb::internal::mail_outbox::construct(), tbb::cache_aligned_allocator< T >::max_size(), and tbb::internal::NFS_Allocate().
